cells.data:
git checkout - # toggle active branch

git branch -d <name> # delete a branch

git config --list #list configs

#during merge
git status #look at unmerged files

#stashing changes
#example of needing to create a hotfix
#in branch featureX
#some work has been done, to save that work and create a new branch for the bug fix do:
git stash
git checkout -b hotfix
#make changes and push up hotfix
git checkout featureX
git stash apply


#pager commands
q #quit
j #down one line
k #up one line
ctrl-f #one screen down
ctrl-b #go up a screen
/      #search /<search_term> 
n # next result
N # previous result

git log --oneline #all commits on one line
git log --decorate   #adds file info
git log --graph  #draws a graph
git log -p #shows the actual changes
git log --stat #shows additions and subtractions

#log filters

git log -3 #shows the 3 most recent
git log --after="yesterday" #show commmits after yesterday
#30 minutes ago or last tuesday, or last week, or march 15th or 3/15/2017
git log --before="yesterday" #can be combined with --after to create bounds
#can also use --since and --until
git log --author="John" #also parses email
git log --author="John\|Jane" #regex
git log --grep="fix" #takes string or regex

#git pick axe
git log -S"route"
git log -S"search term" -p

#git pick axe with regex
git log -G<REGEX>

git log -i #ignore case

#filter merge commits out
git log --no-merges


#rename remotes
git remote -v
# View existing remotes
origin  https://github.com/OWNER/REPOSITORY.git (fetch)
origin  https://github.com/OWNER/REPOSITORY.git (push)

git remote rename origin destination
# Change remote name from 'origin' to 'destination'

git remote -v
# Verify remote's new name
destination  https://github.com/OWNER/REPOSITORY.git (fetch)
destination  https://github.com/OWNER/REPOSITORY.git (push)


# Create new empty branch ??
git checkout --orphan empty
